vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/fb1d4e8e-995e-49fb-a0f6-11442eec4379">VENEZUELA</keyword>         <topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>International Social Survey Programme</i> (ISSP) is a continuing annual programme of cross-national collaboration on surveys covering topics important for social science research. It brings together pre-existing national social science projects and co-ordinates research goals, thereby adding a cross-national, cross-cultural perspective to the individual, national studies. Formed in 1983, the group develops topical modules dealing with important areas of social science as supplements to regular national surveys. Every survey includes questions about general attitudes toward various social issues such as the legal system, gender, and the economy. Special topics have included the environment, the role of government, social inequality, social support, family and gender issues, work orientation, the impact of religious background, behaviour, and beliefs on social and political preferences, and national identity. Participating countries vary for each topical module. <br> <br> The merging of the data into a cross-national dataset is performed by the Leibniz Institute for the Social Sciences, Data Archive for the Social Sciences (GESIS). GESIS was formed in 2007 when three independent institutes merged (Social Science Information Centre (IZ) in Bonn, Central Archive for Empirical Social Research in Cologne (ZA), and Centre for Survey Research and Methodology (ZUMA) in Mannheim).<br> <br> Further information about the survey series is available from the <a href="http://www.gesis.org/en/issp/" title ="International Social Survey Programme">GESIS ISSP</a> web pages.<br> </abstract>       <abstract>The UK Data Archive no longer hold the International Social Survey Programme datasets, they are available to browse, analyse and download online via GESIS's <a href="http://zacat.gesis.org/webview/" title=" ZACAT"> ZACAT</a> service. <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The International Social Survey Programme <a href="http://www.gesis.org/en/issp/issp-modules-profiles/" title=" study profiles"> study profiles </a> provide detailed documentation for each individual ISSP <a href="http://www.gesis.org/en/issp/overview/" title="ISSP module "> module </a>.<br> <br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate>For details of dates of fieldwork and geographic coverage, see the study profile in individual modules.</collDate>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Adults</universe>         <universe>Persons aged 18 and older (see the study profile in individual modules for variations in age range).</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for methods used in different countries</sampProc>         <deviat>see the study profile in individual modules for details of the sample size for each country</deviat>         <collMode>Oral interview and/or self-completion questionnaire: see documentation for exact methods used</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No information recorded</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>These data are available from a service other than UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Third party access conditions apply</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. See <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx>terms and conditions of access</a> for further information.<br/>Available to UK residents or those registered at UK institutions of higher or further education only.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>The ISSP datasets are available to browse, analyse and download online via the German data archive's <a href="http://zacat.gesis.org/" title="ZACAT">ZACAT</a> service.  Data analysis and downloading require online registration with ZACAT and there is no restriction upon who can register.</conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>Jowell, R., Witherspoon, S. and Brook, L.
